result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila appeared by video.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila.  Attorney Mallory Davis for Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
$2500 CASH BOND PREVIOUSLY FORFEITED TO BE REINSTATED. 
Counsel waives time limits. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with QMO and CRG. No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Luis Javier Ortiz-Davila not in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/22/22 @ 1p
